customer_name: Waldens Puddle Center of Greater Nashville

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
The facility's attending veterinarian has completed a written program of veterinary care for the mammals to document the
formal arrangement with the facility. The attending veterinarian and the facility have not yet documented their formal
arrangement via a written program of veterinary care for the exhibition bird species. A written program of veterinary care
is necessary to document the formal arrangements to ensure the health and well-being of both the mammal and bird
species. The facility shall ensure that the formal arrangements with their attending veterinarian for the birds includes a
written program of veterinary care.

The new raccoon enclosure is not currently enclosed by a perimeter fence. The enclosure is surrounded by a hot wire 3 ft.
high around the entire enclosure except for directly in front of the double entrance. A perimeter fence of sufficient height
and strength is necessary to keep unwanted animals and unauthorized persons from having contact with the animals in
the facility and to act as a secondary containment system.
All outdoor housing facilities for the raccoons must be enclosed by a perimeter fence that is at least 6 feet high and
located three feet away from the raccoon enclosure fencing.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The current plan for environment enhancement has not yet been reviewed and approved by the attending veterinarian. A
species appropriate plan is necessary to promote the psychological well-being of the birds and needs to be approved by
the attending veterinarian to ensure it is in accordance with currently accepted professional standards. The plan for
environment enhancement must be approved by the attending veterinarian.
This is a 1st Re-License Inspection for a Class “C” license. The inspection and exit briefing were conducted with the
applicant.
All items must be in compliance within 2 more inspection(s) by Oct. 24, 2023 (60 days counted from 1st RL Inspection) or
the applicant will forfeit the license fee and must wait 6 months to reapply. Please contact your inspector to schedule your
next Re-License Inspection.
Regulated activity can continue under your existing USDA license until it expires.
